hero.title: Church Houses
hero.subtitle: Faith communities that meet in homes for worship, Bible study, and fellowship

beliefs.title: What are Church Houses?
beliefs.introduction: Church Houses are small communities that form a vital part of our church. They are designed to foster deep relationships and spiritual growth.

items.item0: Church Houses provide a space to form genuine relationships and experience authentic Christian community.
items.item1: Each meeting includes time dedicated to studying the Bible and applying its teachings to daily life.
items.item2: Prayer is a central component, where members share needs and celebrate answered prayers.
items.item3: Church Houses facilitate spiritual growth through intentional discipleship and accountability.
items.item4: Regular fellowship strengthens bonds between members and creates a sense of belonging.
items.item5: A HOUSE CHURCH is not the same as a CELL. While a cell is only part of a church, a House Church is the entire church on a small scale, with all its ministries functioning in community.

beliefs.conclusion: Joining a Church House is one of the best ways to connect with our faith community and grow in your walk with Christ.
